intro: Dombeya modesta, commonly known as the modest dombeya, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
